content.question:
A student wants to determine the concentration of permanganate, <math alttext="M n O 4 with a negative 1 charge, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><msub><mtext>MnO</mtext><mn>4</mn></msub><mo>-</mo></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>, in a solution. The student plans to use colorimetric analysis because solutions containing <math alttext="M n O 4 with a negative 1 charge, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><msub><mtext>MnO</mtext><mn>4</mn></msub><mo>-</mo></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> have a purple color.

(a) To determine the optimum wavelength for an experiment that measures the concentration of <math alttext="M n O 4, with a negative 1 charge, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><msub><mtext>MnO</mtext><mn>4</mn></msub><mo>-</mo></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>, the student takes a sample of the solution and measures the amount of light absorbed by the sample over a range of wavelengths. The data are plotted in the graph shown. Identify the optimum wavelength that the student should use for the experimental procedure.

frqParts.text:
A student wants to determine the concentration of permanganate, <math alttext="M n O 4 with a negative 1 charge, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><msub><mtext>MnO</mtext><mn>4</mn></msub><mo>-</mo></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>, in a solution. The student plans to use colorimetric analysis because solutions containing <math alttext="M n O 4 with a negative 1 charge, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><msub><mtext>MnO</mtext><mn>4</mn></msub><mo>-</mo></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> have a purple color.

(a) To determine the optimum wavelength for an experiment that measures the concentration of <math alttext="M n O 4, with a negative 1 charge, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><msub><mtext>MnO</mtext><mn>4</mn></msub><mo>-</mo></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>, the student takes a sample of the solution and measures the amount of light absorbed by the sample over a range of wavelengths. The data are plotted in the graph shown. Identify the optimum wavelength that the student should use for the experimental procedure.

(b) The student uses a stock solution of <math alttext="2.40 times 10 to the negative 3 power, molar, K M n O 4, aqueous " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.40</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><msub><mtext>KMnO</mtext><mn>4</mn></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> to prepare the standard solutions of <math alttext="M n O 4 with a negative 1 charge, aqueous " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><msub><mtext>MnO</mtext><mn>4</mn></msub><mo>-</mo></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> that are needed to construct a calibration curve.

(i) The student uses a <math alttext="100.0 milliliter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>100.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></math> graduated cylinder to measure a certain volume of <math alttext="K M n O 4, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>KMnO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> stock solution, as shown in the diagram given. What volume should the student record?
(ii) Calculate the volume, in mL, of <math alttext="2.40 times 10 to the negative 3 power, molar, K M n O 4, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.40</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext><msub><mtext>MnO</mtext><mn>4</mn></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> that is required to produce <math alttext="100.0 milliliters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100.</mn><mtext></mtext><mn>0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of a standard <math alttext="1.68 times 10 to the negative 3 power, molar, M n O 4, with a negative 1 charge, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.68</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><msup><msub><mtext>MnO</mtext><mn>4</mn></msub><mo>-</mo></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> solution.

The student designs the following procedure to produce a calibration curve.
Step 1: Prepare several standard solutions that have known <math alttext="M n O 4, with a negative 1 charge, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><msub><mtext>MnO</mtext><mn>4</mn></msub><mo>-</mo></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> concentrations by dilution of the stock solution.
Step 2: Rinse the cuvette with distilled water.
Step 3: Rinse the cuvette with the standard solution and fill the cuvette with the standard solution.
Step 4: Measure the absorbance of the standard solution with the colorimeter.
Step 5: Repeat steps <math alttext="2 through 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>2-4</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> for each of the standard solutions.
The data are plotted in the calibration curve shown. One of the data points (indicated with an arrow) on the calibration curve is below the line of best fit.

(c) Assuming that all lab equipment is functioning properly, identify which one of the procedural steps the student could have executed incorrectly that would explain why the marked data point is below the line of best fit. Justify your answer.

skill.text: 2.D: Make observations or collect data from representations of laboratory setups or results, while attending to precision where appropriate.
